trans-unit.source: New Scenarios and Features in WMF 5.1 (Preview)
trans-unit.target: New Scenarios and Features in WMF 5.1 (Preview)

trans-unit.source: PowerShell, DSC, WMF
trans-unit.target: PowerShell, DSC, WMF

trans-unit.source: New Scenarios and Features in WMF 5.1 (Preview)
trans-unit.target: New Scenarios and Features in WMF 5.1 (Preview)

trans-unit.source: Note: This information is preliminary and subject to change.
trans-unit.target: Note: This information is preliminary and subject to change.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Editions
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Editions

trans-unit.source: Starting with version 5.1, PowerShell is available in different editions which denote varying feature sets and platform compatibility.
trans-unit.target: Starting with version 5.1, PowerShell is available in different editions which denote varying feature sets and platform compatibility.

trans-unit.source: **Desktop Edition:** Built on .NET Framework and provides compatibility with scripts and modules targeting versions of PowerShell running on full footprint editions of Windows such as Server Core and Windows Desktop.
trans-unit.target: **Desktop Edition:** Built on .NET Framework and provides compatibility with scripts and modules targeting versions of PowerShell running on full footprint editions of Windows such as Server Core and Windows Desktop.

trans-unit.source: **Core Edition:** Built on .NET Core and provides compatibility with scripts and modules targeting versions of PowerShell running on reduced footprint editions of Windows such as Nano Server and Windows IoT.
trans-unit.target: **Core Edition:** Built on .NET Core and provides compatibility with scripts and modules targeting versions of PowerShell running on reduced footprint editions of Windows such as Nano Server and Windows IoT.

trans-unit.source: **Learn more about using PowerShell Editions**
trans-unit.target: **Learn more about using PowerShell Editions**

trans-unit.target: [Determine running edition of PowerShell]()

trans-unit.target: [Declare a module's compatibility to specific PowerShell versions]()

trans-unit.target: [Filter Get-Module results by CompatiblePSEditions]()

trans-unit.target: [Prevent script execution unless run on a compatible edition of PowerShell]()

trans-unit.source: Catalog Cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Catalog Cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Two new cmdlets have been added in the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Security](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh847877.aspx) module; these generate and validate Windows catalog files.
trans-unit.target: Two new cmdlets have been added in the [Microsoft.PowerShell.Security](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh847877.aspx) module; these generate and validate Windows catalog files.

trans-unit.source: New-FileCatalog
trans-unit.target: New-FileCatalog

trans-unit.source: New-FileCatalog creates a Windows catalog file for set of folders and files.
trans-unit.target: New-FileCatalog creates a Windows catalog file for set of folders and files.

trans-unit.source: This catalog file contains hashes for all files in specified paths.
trans-unit.target: This catalog file contains hashes for all files in specified paths.

trans-unit.source: Users can distribute the set of folders along with corresponding catalog file representing those folders.
trans-unit.target: Users can distribute the set of folders along with corresponding catalog file representing those folders.

trans-unit.source: This information is useful to validate whether any changes have been made to the folders since catalog creation time.
trans-unit.target: This information is useful to validate whether any changes have been made to the folders since catalog creation time.

trans-unit.source: Catalog versions 1 and 2 are supported.
trans-unit.target: Catalog versions 1 and 2 are supported.

trans-unit.source: Version 1 uses the SHA1 hashing algorithm to create file hashes; version 2 uses SHA256.
trans-unit.target: Version 1 uses the SHA1 hashing algorithm to create file hashes; version 2 uses SHA256.

trans-unit.source: Catalog version 2 is not supported on *Windows Server 2008 R2* or *Windows 7*.
trans-unit.target: Catalog version 2 is not supported on *Windows Server 2008 R2* or *Windows 7*.

trans-unit.source: You should use catalog version 2 on *Windows 8*, *Windows Server 2012*, and later operating systems.
trans-unit.target: You should use catalog version 2 on *Windows 8*, *Windows Server 2012*, and later operating systems.

trans-unit.source: This creates the catalog file.
trans-unit.target: This creates the catalog file.

trans-unit.source: To verify the integrity of catalog file (Pester.cat in above example), sign it using [Set-AuthenticodeSignature](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849819.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To verify the integrity of catalog file (Pester.cat in above example), sign it using [Set-AuthenticodeSignature](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849819.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Test-FileCatalog
trans-unit.target: Test-FileCatalog

trans-unit.source: Test-FileCatalog validates the catalog representing a set of folders.
trans-unit.target: Test-FileCatalog validates the catalog representing a set of folders.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet compares all the files hashes and their relative paths found in *catalog* with ones on *disk*.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet compares all the files hashes and their relative paths found in *catalog* with ones on *disk*.

trans-unit.source: If it detects any mismatch between file hashes and paths it returns the status as *ValidationFailed*.
trans-unit.target: If it detects any mismatch between file hashes and paths it returns the status as *ValidationFailed*.

trans-unit.source: Users can retrieve all this information by using the *-Detailed* parameter.
trans-unit.target: Users can retrieve all this information by using the *-Detailed* parameter.

trans-unit.source: It also displays signing status of catalog in *Signature* property which is equivalent to calling [Get-AuthenticodeSignature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh849805.aspx) cmdlet on the catalog file.
trans-unit.target: It also displays signing status of catalog in *Signature* property which is equivalent to calling [Get-AuthenticodeSignature](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh849805.aspx) cmdlet on the catalog file.

trans-unit.source: Users can also skip any file during validation by using the *-FilesToSkip* parameter.
trans-unit.target: Users can also skip any file during validation by using the *-FilesToSkip* parameter.

trans-unit.source: Module Analysis Cache
trans-unit.target: Module Analysis Cache

trans-unit.source: Starting with WMF 5.1, PowerShell provides control over the file that is used to cache data about a module, such as the commands it exports.
trans-unit.target: Starting with WMF 5.1, PowerShell provides control over the file that is used to cache data about a module, such as the commands it exports.

trans-unit.source: By default, this cache is stored in the file `${env:LOCALAPPDATA}\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ModuleAnalysisCache`.
trans-unit.target: By default, this cache is stored in the file `${env:LOCALAPPDATA}\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ModuleAnalysisCache`.

trans-unit.source: The cache is typically read at startup while searching for a command and is written on a background thread sometime after a module is imported.
trans-unit.target: The cache is typically read at startup while searching for a command and is written on a background thread sometime after a module is imported.

trans-unit.source: To change the default location of the cache, set the `$env:PSModuleAnalysisCachePath` environment variable before starting PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: To change the default location of the cache, set the `$env:PSModuleAnalysisCachePath` environment variable before starting PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Changes to this environment variable will only affect children processes.
trans-unit.target: Changes to this environment variable will only affect children processes.

trans-unit.source: The value should name a full path (including filename) that PowerShell has permission to create and write files.
trans-unit.target: The value should name a full path (including filename) that PowerShell has permission to create and write files.

trans-unit.source: To disable the file cache, set this value to an invalid location, for example:
trans-unit.target: To disable the file cache, set this value to an invalid location, for example:

trans-unit.source: This sets the path to an invalid device.
trans-unit.target: This sets the path to an invalid device.

trans-unit.source: If PowerShell can't write to the path, no error is returned, but you can see error reporting by using a tracer:
trans-unit.target: If PowerShell can't write to the path, no error is returned, but you can see error reporting by using a tracer:

trans-unit.source: When writing out the cache, PowerShell will check for modules that no longer exist to avoid an unnecessarily large cache.
trans-unit.target: When writing out the cache, PowerShell will check for modules that no longer exist to avoid an unnecessarily large cache.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes these checks are not desirable, in which case you can turn them off by setting:
trans-unit.target: Sometimes these checks are not desirable, in which case you can turn them off by setting:

trans-unit.source: Setting this environment variable will take effect immediately in the current process.
trans-unit.target: Setting this environment variable will take effect immediately in the current process.

trans-unit.source: Specifying module version
trans-unit.target: Specifying module version

trans-unit.source: In WMF 5.1, `using module` behaves the same way as other module-related constructions in PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: In WMF 5.1, `using module` behaves the same way as other module-related constructions in PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Previously, you had no way to specify a particular module version; if there were multiple versions present, this resulted in an error.
trans-unit.target: Previously, you had no way to specify a particular module version; if there were multiple versions present, this resulted in an error.

trans-unit.source: In WMF 5.1:
trans-unit.target: In WMF 5.1:

trans-unit.source: You can use `ModuleSpecification` [hash table](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj136290(v=vs.85).aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can use `ModuleSpecification` [hash table](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj136290(v=vs.85).aspx).

trans-unit.source: This hash table has the same format as `Get-Module -FullyQualifiedName`.
trans-unit.target: This hash table has the same format as `Get-Module -FullyQualifiedName`.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** `using module @{ModuleName = 'PSReadLine'; RequiredVersion = '1.1'}`
trans-unit.target: **Example:** `using module @{ModuleName = 'PSReadLine'; RequiredVersion = '1.1'}`

trans-unit.source: If there are multiple versions of the module, PowerShell uses the **same resolution logic** as `Import-Module` and doesn't return an error--the same behavior as `Import-Module` and `Import-DscResource`.
trans-unit.target: If there are multiple versions of the module, PowerShell uses the **same resolution logic** as `Import-Module` and doesn't return an error--the same behavior as `Import-Module` and `Import-DscResource`.

trans-unit.source: Improvements to Pester
trans-unit.target: Improvements to Pester

trans-unit.source: In WMF 5.1, the version of Pester that ships with PowerShell has been updated from 3.3.5 to 3.4.0, with the addition of commit https://github.com/pester/Pester/pull/484/commits/3854ae8a1f215b39697ac6c2607baf42257b102e, which enables better behavior for Pester on Nano Server.
trans-unit.target: In WMF 5.1, the version of Pester that ships with PowerShell has been updated from 3.3.5 to 3.4.0, with the addition of commit https://github.com/pester/Pester/pull/484/commits/3854ae8a1f215b39697ac6c2607baf42257b102e, which enables better behavior for Pester on Nano Server.

trans-unit.source: You can review the changes in versions 3.3.5 to 3.4.0 by inspecting the ChangeLog.md file at: https://github.com/pester/Pester/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
trans-unit.target: You can review the changes in versions 3.3.5 to 3.4.0 by inspecting the ChangeLog.md file at: https://github.com/pester/Pester/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
